body:
Did you try giving the absolute path as an argument?
and Also check whether the mlruns/0/7989340d41e544d2a5e2167e54e19975/artifacts/model/ folder has MLmodel file

1. I tried all possible paths for runs options. Absolute path is not working. it has to start with /0, with and without MLModel.
I am saving the model using log_model here.

2. Changed to save_model
mlflow.sklearn.save_model(lr, 'D:\\tmp\\skmodels')    
# mlflow models build-docker --model-uri "file:D:\tmp\skmodels" -n "my-bda_mlflow-image"

ERROR:

mlflow models build-docker --model-uri "file:D:\tmp\skmodels" -n "my-bda_mlflow-image"
_get_flavor_backend

artifact_path = MLmodel

Too many issues in resolving the path and copying artifacts code.

Summary:
using windows posix path also does not resolve.

on ubuntu it works with full path - file for a built model.
mlflow models build-docker -m "file:/home/<user>/Share/skmodels/" -n "bda_mlflow-image"
